arm_group.description: anal dilation, colonic lavage, oral probiotic

brief_summary.textblock:
The present study was designed to compare the efficacy of conservative treatment to
      operative treatment for improvement of constipation symptoms in infants with short or
      normal-segment Hirschsprung disease.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Trial on Conservative Treatment for Infants' Hirschsprung Disease

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Hard or firm stools for twice or less per week

          -  Age were from newborn to 3 months

          -  Histochemical acetylcholinesterase reaction (AChE) in rectal mucosa was positive

          -  The narrowed distal bowel on barium enema was characterized as normal or
             short-segment Hirschsprung disease with a 24h barium retention

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Children >3months of age

          -  Patients presented severe inflammation or malnutrition, unconsciousness, and symptoms
             of a ruptured hollow viscus

          -  Barium enema showed long-segment or total colonic aganglionic bowel

clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Randomized Controlled Trial of Conservative Versus Surgery Treatment of Normal and Short-segment Hirschsprung Disease for Infants

primary_outcome.description: the changes of defecation frequence at 6~12 months after treatment
